intro: Stackhousia viminea var. elata, commonly known as the slender stackhousia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Proteaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal and sandy soils, thriving in full sun to partial shade. Its ornamental value comes from its delicate foliage and long-lasting blooms, making it a popular choice for gardens and landscaping.
